intro: Satyrium plantagineum, commonly known as the common satyrium, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. The flowers are usually white or pale pink and are pollinated by insects such as bees and flies.
